headline: Norway says it seeks to keep large US investments despite Caterpillar brawl
summary: OSLO (Reuters) -Norway's Finance Minister Jens Stoltenberg said on Tuesday he hopes the country's $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, can maintain its current investment policy in which about half the assets are invested in the U.S.  President Donald Trump's administration said last week it was "very troubled" by the Norwegian fund's divestment of U.S. construction equipment group Caterpillar, and that it was engaging with Norway's government on the issue.  Based on recommendations from an ethics watchdog, the fund last month said it had sold its Caterpillar stake due to the company's supply to Israel of bulldozers used in the occupation of Gaza and the West Bank.

headline: Is Caterpillar Still Worth a Look After Norway Wealth Fund Divestment?
summary: Thinking about what to do with Caterpillar stock? You are definitely not alone. In fact, plenty of investors are wrestling with the same decision. Caterpillar has been front and center in the headlines lately, with Norway’s massive sovereign wealth fund deciding to divest, sparking some political reaction and debate around the company’s risk profile. Yet when you zoom out from the headlines, Caterpillar’s stock has quietly notched an impressive set of returns. The stock is up 28.6% over the...

headline: Caterpillar: Valuation Gap Continues Widednig
summary: Caterpillar's recent share price performance has created a notable valuation gap to the company's business fundamentals and this now poses significant risk for shareholders.

headline: 1 Industrials Stock Worth Your Attention and 2 We Question
summary: Even if they go mostly unnoticed, industrial businesses are the backbone of our country. Their momentum is also rising as lower interest rates have incentivized higher capital spending. As a result, the industry has posted a 23.9% gain over the past six months, beating the S&P 500 by 8.1 percentage points.
